channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Plans to set up recycling association with international experts here by October
item.description:
August 12, 2020 4:50 PM

SINGAPORE - The Singaporean-German Chamber of Industry and Commerce (SGC) announced on Wednesday (Aug 12) plans to establish a Plastics Recycling Association and a Centre of Excellence for recycling here, with the eventual goal of turning Singapore into a regional hub of excellence in plastics recycling.

item.title: MAS urges financial institutions to groom local leaders and grow Singaporean talent pool
item.description:
August 12, 2020 4:48 PM

SINGAPORE - Financial institutions should continue to identify Singaporeans with high potential for leadership roles and expand the supply of talented locals, the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) said on Wednesday (Aug 12).

item.title: Woman jailed 20 months over using bank accounts to receive proceeds from scams
item.description:
August 12, 2020 4:33 PM

SINGAPORE - A 64 -year-old woman continued to use her bank accounts to receive funds from people she did not know, despite receiving repeated warnings by the Commercial Affairs Department (CAD) not to do so.

item.title: 40,000 more workers can resume work as some conditions eased to accelerate construction site restart
item.description:
August 12, 2020 4:27 PM

SINGAPORE - Companies with foreign construction workers registered with the Ministry of Manpower (MOM) can now restart some work without needing approval from the Building and Construction Authority (BCA).

item.title: 42 new Covid-19 cases in Singapore, including 1 in the community and 11 imported
item.description:
August 12, 2020 3:43 PM

The community case is a Singaporean. The imported cases had been placed on stay-home notices upon arrival in Singapore.

item.title: Couple charged with encroaching on state land for building gate, walls and fence around their house
item.description:
August 12, 2020 3:06 PM

SINGAPORE - The owners of a house in Jalan Kayu estate who built a metal gate, two boundary walls and a fence around the landed property have been charged with encroaching on state land.

item.title: NTU appoints distinguished gastroenterologist as new dean of medical school
item.description:
August 12, 2020 2:53 PM

SINGAPORE - Hong Kong gastroenterologist and academic leader Joseph Sung will be joining Nanyang Technological University (NTU) as the new dean of the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, NTU announced on Tuesday (Aug 11).

item.title: Former Sats officer jailed 10 months for offering contracts for cash involving over $150,000
item.description:
August 12, 2020 2:11 PM

Lim Koon Chuan, 59, took multiple bribes in exchange for helping companies get awarded tender contracts.

item.title: 4 new SkillsFuture work-study programmes to offer more than 140 places over next two years
item.description:
August 12, 2020 12:35 PM

SINGAPORE - Four new SkillsFuture work-study programmes, offering more than 140 places over the next two years, will be introduced by higher learning institutes to provide Singaporeans with more work-study opportunities in emerging and growth sectors.

item.title: Nearly a third of 18,000 stalls in hawker centres and markets now offer e-payments
item.description:
August 12, 2020 12:00 PM

Nearly 2,000 stallholders came on board over the past two months to bring the total to 5,400.

item.title: NDP organisers apologise for Tamil language errors in NDP 2020 evening show
item.description:
August 12, 2020 10:58 AM

A line of the Tamil song lyrics displayed on the screens as part of a performance had misaligned characters due to the animation effects.

item.title: More than 7,800 HDB BTO flats in 8 estates, including in Bishan, Ang Mo Kio, launched in combined sales exercise
item.description:
August 12, 2020 10:55 AM

For the first time in 14 years, 472 new units are up for sale in the mature estate of Bishan.

item.title: Human-like autonomous driving beyond today's tech, says newly-formed Motional
item.description:
August 12, 2020 10:21 AM

SINGAPORE - The technology to allow a driverless vehicle to move fully autonomously is not ready yet, according to a leading autonomous vehicle company.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Aug 12
Woman loses bid to sue HC Surgical CEO over clinic stake purchase
item.description:
August 12, 2020 5:00 AM

A woman, who successfully defended against a defamation suit by a surgeon earlier this year, has failed in her bid to have a company sue its chief executive over its purchase of a further stake in the surgeon's private clinic.

item.title: Japanese minister first top-level official to visit S'pore since Covid-19 outbreak
item.description:
August 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Japan's top diplomat Toshimitsu Motegi will arrive in Singapore today for a three-day visit, becoming the first high-ranking minister to make an official visit to the Republic since border restrictions were put in place due to Covid-19.

item.title: Members of the public to get regular updates on job market in Singapore
item.description:
August 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Members of the public will get regular updates on the job market, including employment opportunities and retrenchments, through weekly reports by the Ministry of Manpower in the coming months.

item.title: S'pore to crush illegal ivory worth $18m
item.description:
August 12, 2020 5:00 AM

The National Parks Board (NParks) began crushing $18 million worth of illegal ivory, weighing around nine tonnes, yesterday.

item.title: Fresh cases detected at dormitories cleared of Covid-19
item.description:
August 12, 2020 5:00 AM

There have been new cases detected at dormitories declared to be cleared of the coronavirus, and the authorities are monitoring the situation to manage the risk of new outbreaks.

item.title: 92,000 new jobs, training positions generated as at end-July
item.description:
August 12, 2020 5:00 AM

A combined effort by the public and private sectors has generated around 92,000 new positions - jobs, traineeship and attachment opportunities - it was announced yesterday.

item.title: Entry restrictions at 4 popular markets eased on weekdays
item.description:
August 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Entry restrictions at four popular wet markets will be eased from tomorrow after a noticeable reduction in weekday queues, the National Environment Agency (NEA) said yesterday.

item.title: Weekly jobs reports will be helpful, but include more details to aid job seekers
item.description:
August 12, 2020 5:00 AM

The Ministry of Manpower (MOM) published the first of its planned series of weekly jobs situation reports yesterday, in conjunction with the Ministry of Trade and Industry's (MTI) second-quarter gross domestic product statistics.

item.title: Jeweller fined for failing to report $20,000 cash sale
item.description:
August 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Even after a customer paid jeweller Poh Heng more than $20,000 in cash from his bag and pockets, it did not raise the alarm with the authorities about the transaction.

item.title: First phase of trials starts for Covid-19 vaccine by Duke-NUS, US firm
item.description:
August 12, 2020 5:00 AM

The first cohort of volunteers here has received a dose of a coronavirus vaccine jointly developed by Duke-NUS Medical School and United States pharmaceutical company Arcturus Therapeutics.

item.title: NTUC LearningHub to provide taxi, private-hire driver training
item.description:
August 12, 2020 5:00 AM

From Sept 1, those aiming to be licensed as taxi or private-hire drivers will be able to attend courses at a third training provider: NTUC LearningHub.

item.title: Coronavirus: Tracking workers' health with mobile apps, wearable devices
item.description:
August 12, 2020 5:00 AM

As the economy and travel gradually restart, migrant workers re-entering both the country and the workforce pose potential Covid-19 risks.

item.title: 61 new coronavirus cases, lowest daily figure since April 2
item.description:
August 12, 2020 5:00 AM

A total of 61 new Covid-19 patients were announced by the Ministry of Health (MOH) yesterday, the lowest daily total in more than four months since April 2, when 49 new infections were reported.

item.title: New guide on smart home tech for people with disabilities
item.description:
August 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Smart home technology has helped 26-year-old Isabelle Lim, who is deaf, to live more independently.

item.title: Man on trial for dad's murder may qualify for 'unsound mind' defence
item.description:
August 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Left alone with his elderly father for three hours in their Bedok North flat, an "unstable" unemployed man allegedly attacked the 75-year-old, who was later found lying in a pool of blood.

item.title: Jail, caning for man who raped girl, posted nude photos of ex-partners
item.description:
August 12, 2020 5:00 AM

A 26-year-old man was sentenced yesterday in the High Court to 10 years and 10 weeks in jail, as well as six strokes of the cane, after he pleaded guilty to statutory rape.

item.title: Li Shengwu says he will pay fine but denies guilt over contempt of court
item.description:
August 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Dr Li Shengwu has said he will pay a $15,000 fine for contempt of court, but he does not admit guilt and disagrees that he has said anything illegal in a private Facebook post.

item.title: Supervisor jailed, ship repair firm fined $300k
item.description:
August 12, 2020 5:00 AM

The assistant diving supervisor of a ship repair company was sentenced to 12 weeks in jail yesterday over an underwater incident in 2014 which led to the death of a diver.
